names.pinyin: shi liu wei liu qi yin
names.english: sixteen ingredient drink for qi flow
names.commonEnglish: Sixteen Ingredient Drink for Qi Flow
aka: Sixteen Ingredients Regulate Qi Special Formula

actions: Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
With Huang Qi, for ulcerated abscesses with insufficient drainage or which drain a clear thin discharge.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, expels Wind and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
With Rou Gui, for irregular menstruation with Cold in the Blood.
Nourishes the Blood, regulates menstruation, astringes Yin, adjusts the Ying and Wei, softens the Liver and relieves pain.
With Gan Cao, regulates the relationship between the Liver and Spleen.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
With Huang Qi and Ren Shen, restrains sweating from Deficiency.
Tonifies Qi and Blood, promotes the discharge of pus, generates flesh and expels toxins.
With Ren Shen, for Qi Deficiency.
With Dang Gui and Rou Gui, for flat sores that do not pustulate or ulcers that do not heal.
With Ren Shen, Dang Gui, Chuan Xiong, Bai Zhi and Fang Feng, for chronic sores with underlying Deficiency.
Tonifies Qi.
With Zi Su Ye, for External Wind-Cold with underlying Qi Deficiency.
Disperses deep Cold, warms the channels, unblocks the channels and vessels and alleviates pain.
With Huang Qi and Dang Gui, for Yin-type boils due to Qi and Blood Deficiency especially those that form but do not ulcerate.
Promotes the movement of Qi in the Middle Jiao, resolves Stagnation, promotes the movement of Qi downward, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Zhi Ke, for abdominal distention due to Qi and Food Stagnation.
Expels pus and opens and raises Lung Qi, directing the effects of other herbs to the upper body.
With Gan Cao, disseminates Lung Qi, expels Phlegm, resolves toxicity, and expels pus.
Promotes the movement of Qi, reduces distention and pressure and resolves hardenings.
Promotes movement of Qi, warms the Kidneys, disperses Cold and alleviates pain.
With Mu Xiang and Zhi Ke, for epigastric and abdominal pain and distention due to Cold Stagnation and Qi Obstruction.
With Dang Gui, disperses Cold and stops pain, for abdominal pain due to External Cold..
Promotes the movement of Qi, strengthens the Spleen, prevents Stagnation and alleviates pain.
Reduces swelling, eliminates toxins and expels pus.
With JIe Geng, for ulcerated boils when pus has not been discharged.
Regulates Qi, reduces accumulations, drains downward and unblocks the bowels.
Releases the Exterior and expels External Wind.
Releases the Exterior, disperses Cold and promotes the movement of Spleen and Stomach Qi.
With Jie Geng and Zhi Ke, eases the diaphragm and Intestines.
With Chuan Xiong and Dang Gui, harmonizes the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Clears Heat and relieves Fire toxicity and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs.
Tonifies Qi
Nourishes the Blood
Promotes the movement of Qi and Blood
Disperses Stagnation
Expels pus
Dissipates swelling

manifestations.pulse: Wiry and rapid or Flooding or Tight or Thin

notes: The primary External disharmony is usually Heat or Qi and Blood Stagnation.
The primary Internal disharmony is usually is Deficiency.
Many feel that this formula is best used as a follow-up to more aggressive initial treatment.

modifications.purpose: leaking sores that fail to dry
swellings that are slow to come to a head and burst
various swellings, nodules lumps, fibroids and carbuncles
fibrocystic growths related to estrogen intake
